paramInformation.label: Setting device status after power failure
paramInformation.description: Define how the Switch reacts after the power supply is back on

paramInformation.label: Notification when Load status change
paramInformation.description: Touch Switch can send notifications to association device when state of Touch Switch’s load change.

options.label: Enabled only when Load condition is not changed by Z-WAVE Command

metadata.inclusion:
• Connect the power supply. 
• Set the Z-Wave network main controller into learning mode. 
• Press and hold the button 1 (the red light flashes slowly) until the pink light flashes slowly and then release, the device sends the network k information (blue light flashes quickly). 
• After the network is successfully connected, the LED indicator of the device is steady blue, and the load is off by default.
metadata.exclusion:
• Power on the switch. 
• Set the Z-Wave network controller into the exclusion mode. 
• Long press the switch button 1 (Red LED blink slowly) when Pink LED indicator light blink slowly, release the button, then the device start to send out exclusion information(Blue LED indicator in quick blinking). 
• When exclusion successfully, LED display is steady blue, load is off.
metadata.reset:
Reset procedure will delete all information in the Z-Wave network or Z-Wave gateway, and will restore switch to factory default settings. 
• Make sure switch is powered. 
• Press and hold the Switch button 1 for 20 seconds. 
• Until the pink light is always on, release the button. 
 Use this procedure only in the event that the network primary controller is missing or otherwise inoperable.
